feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAC - Update Dimension Values in a Planning Model Without Deleting Transaction Data (ID changed)
entry.content:
Dear Community
I’m working with a SAC planning model that includes a dimension called ProductID. In our legacy system, products were stored with older IDs (product A). In our new system, these same products now have updated IDs (ABC).

I would like to update the ProductID values in the dimension so that all existing transactional data reflects the new product IDs. However, I want to avoid deleting and reloading all the transactional data that has already been imported (using an upload job).

My question: Is there a way in SAC to replace old dimension member IDs with new ones without removing the existing transactional data? For example, can ProductID “A” be changed to “ABC” in a way that automatically updates all related transaction records?

Any guidance, workarounds would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Create Ranking Bucket in SAC Story Chart
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a business requirement to create ranking buckets in an SAC Story chart. While the built-in ranking function allows the creation of Top/Bottom-N rankings, it does not provide a way to define custom ranking buckets.

Is there a method to achieve this—either through a calculated measure or dimension, or by using scripting? A sample chart is attached for reference.

Ranking buckets we are looking for-

Ranking BucketTotal Amount
Rank 1XXX.xx
Rank 2-5XXX.xx
Rank 6-10XXX.xx
Rank 11-20XXX.xx
All OtherXXX.xx

entry.title: [SAC] Minor inconvenience on responsive functionnality since the update. Bug or intended ?
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I have been working on making my reports responsive recently, and since the last update, I encounter a little issue, which I wanted to share with you, in order to have more information about it, or if it is not intended, simply report that this exists.

When you are in the builder panel of your section, working to adapt the size of your widget, you have the possibility to switch from 'Free' to 'Auto-Flow'. 

My issue comes up when you want to add a widget in the 'Widget Width' or 'Height' section. In free mode, you can 'Add widget', and then you have a Drop-down panel to choose the widget you wish to adapt.  And as long as I remember, it always worked like this. 

 

 

But now, when I switch to Auto-flow, the drop-down still exists, but does not allow me to select other widgets, so I have to add all my widgets first, and then adapt the sizes.

 

 

I don't know if this was intended, but I find it a bit annoying since the report updates only when all fields are filled in.

Let me know if you face the same problem, and if anyone has information about it, I would be really interested !

Have a nice day,

Julien Dorffer

entry.title: How can AI agents be integrated with SAP BTP to automate student support and academic workflows
entry.content:
How can AI agents be integrated with SAP BTP to automate student support and academic workflows in higher education?

I’m exploring the use of AI agents for higher education and want to understand how SAP technologies can support this.
Has anyone implemented AI agents or intelligent automation on SAP BTP, SAP Analytics Cloud, or SAP S/4HANA for university operations?

I’m interested in learning how AI agents can help with:

Automating student inquiries

Enhancing academic workflow management

Integrating with LMS/SIS platforms

Predictive analytics for student success

Improving administrative efficiency on campus

What are the recommended SAP services, integration patterns, or best practices for deploying AI agents securely and at scale in a higher education environment?

entry.title: sac advanced formula - searching for the right record in a linked model in a foreach statement
entry.content:
Hi,

I have an advanced formula that needs to find a specific record in a linked model.

Here is example data for both models:

The main model contains hours per month, employees, and PSP.

Date

FCMONTH

PERSONAL

PARAMETER

PSPELEMENT

BMOT

DESTINATION

VTYPE

HOURS

REVENUE

202501

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

83

 

202503

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

100

 

2025010

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

60

 

2025011

000000

100

101

235.02

I1

#

020

75

 

202501

000000

101

101

235.02

I1

#

020

110

 

202504

000000

101

101

235.02

I1

#

020

43

 

202501

000000

102

101

235.02

I1

#

020

24

 

The linked model contains the hourly rates for employees, PSP, and valid from month

Date

VALIDFROM

PSPELEMENT

PERSONAL

PARAMETER

BMOT

DESTINATION

AMOUNT

000000

202501

235.02

100

1

I1

#

165

000000

202510

235.02

100

1

I1

#

180

000000

202501

235.02

101

1

I1

#

165

000000

202501

235.02

102

1

I1

#

165

My formula looks as follows:

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/PSPELEMENT] = BASEMEMBER([d/PSPELEMENT].[h/PSPHIER], %PSPElemBaseMember%)
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = %STARTDATUM% TO %ENDDATUM%
MEMBERSET [d/Parametertyp] = "100"
MEMBERSET [d/VTYPE] = %VTYPE%
MEMBERSET [d/PERSONAL] = %Mitarbeiter%

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MODEL [APC_BASIC_DATA]
ENDMODEL

FOREACH [d/PERSONAL], [APC_BASIC_DATA].[d/VALIDFROM] ASC
	IF DATEDIFF([d/Date], [APC_BASIC_DATA].[d/VALIDFROM], "MONTH") >= 0 THEN
		IF LINK([APC_BASIC_DATA], [d/Measures] = "Betrag", [d/PSPELEMENT] = %PSPElemQuelle%, [d/Parametertyp] = "1", [d/Version] = "public.Actual", [d/Date] = "000000") > 0 THEN

			DATA([d/Measures] = "Umsatz") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "STUNDEN") * LINK([APC_BASIC_DATA], [d/Measures] = "Betrag", [d/PSPELEMENT] = %PSPElemQuelle%, [d/Parametertyp] = "1", [d/Version] = "public.Actual", [d/Date] = "000000")

		ENDIF
	ENDIF
ENDFOR

The purpose of this function is to find the correct hourly rate for each data record in the main model and then to calculate the revenue.

The FOREACH should check for each employee and validfrom whether the month of the current record in the main model is greater than or equal to the validfrom month of the linked model. By sorting in ascending order, I ensure that the hourly rate with the largest validfrom month is calculated last and that each hour is calculated with the correct hourly rate.

The problem is that the LINK command within the FOREACH does not take the validfrom value of the current iteration. It seems as if it takes the aggregation of all hourly rates for an employee.

How can I specify the filter for the validfrom dimension of the current iteration in the LINK command?

Thanks in advance.

Kind regards,
Max

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud: Assertion Failed could not find translatable text
entry.content:
Hi All,

A client of mine is experiencing a UI issue in their SAC tenants. See below.

When looking, this is the case for multiple users. Although my user is not experiencing it. Potentially because I am using a different network and security setup than the client. 

When opening console, I get large number of the following error: Assertion Failed Could not find translatable text.

Any suggestions as to what is causing this and how to fix, would be much appreciated.

Thanks,

Charles

entry.title: Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number
entry.content:
Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number for the GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode columns.

When trying to load data into the Modeler Model using SAC, the hierarchical structure defined is GLAccountHierarchy --> ParentNode --> GLAccount.

The data listed in GLAccountHiearchywithParentandAccount.txt should be used. The data load is not functioning properly because multiple GLAccounts have the same GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode column values. 

How can I resolve this issue? What is the process for creating a GL Account Hierarchy structure with this data?

Thanks again.

entry.title: Inventory Aging in SAC story , using the User Input Date from Datasphere Analytical Model
entry.content:
Hi

I am working in an SAC Story and need to create dynamic inventory aging buckets using LIFO method.

 The  Analytical mode  is from DataSphere is having the User Input Date, which is prompted in SAC while executing the Story.

Example:

  • Material:  ABC

  • Closing Stock: 100 Qty (as on the User Input Date : 15/Nov/2025)

  • Purchases done :

    • 25 Qty purchased on 31/Oct/2025 ( 15 days ago)

    • 200 Qty purchased on 31/Oct/2024 ( 1 Year ago)

Expected Aging Output (all slabs):

Aging Slab (Days) Quantity
0–3025
31–600
61–900
91–1200
>12175
Total100

Challenge:
The User Input Date comes from the Datasphere model ( we not using the Planning Model), and I am unable to capture this date inside SAC formulas to dynamically calculate the aging buckets.

The Total of all the Aging bucket should not be more than the Closing Inventory Available!

Any guidance, would be greatly appreciated.

This type of logic was easy to achieve in BEx Query Designer by using MIN, MAX, and SIGN functions, but I’m finding it difficult to replicate in SAC.

entry.content:

  • Parent node: "PC Hier"

entry.title: YTD Calculation in Restricted/Calculated Measure with 200 Dimensions in SAP DataSphere
entry.content:
Context and Goal

We are building an Analytic Model in SAP Datasphere, based on a view with approximately 200 columns/dimensions. Our goal is to calculate the Year-to-Date (YTD) value for the measure "SalesAmount". The YTD calculation must be dynamic, allowing the end-user to analyze the result by Year, Month, and any of the ~198 remaining dimensions in the model (example: Customer, Product, Region, etc.).

Attempted Solutions and Specific Issue
 We have tried to implement the YTD calculation directly within the Analytic Model, following SAP documentation:

1. Restricted Measure Attempt: 

     Expression: We defined a restricted measure for "SalesAmount" with the following filter condition on the date dimension ("SalesDate"):  SalesDate IN (YTD(SalesDate))

     Result: The model fails to activate. Upon deployment, Datasphere throws the following syntax error:

           Reason: Invalid syntax or usage of unsupported function. unexpected character: ->Y<- at offset: 0, skipped 3 characters.

Observation: The YTD() function does not seem to be recognized or supported in this context/syntax, despite being suggested by the expression editor.

2. Calculated Measure Attempt:

  • Expression: We also tried creating a calculated measure using the YTD() function:  YTD(SalesAmount, SalesDate)

  • Result: The outcome is the same; the model fails to activate and shows the identical syntax error related to the 'Y' character.

3. SQL View Implementation (Window Function):

  • Approach: We tried calculating the running total using the OVER (PARTITION BY Year ORDER BY Month) window function within the source view (View Builder).

  • Limitation: This approach is unworkable because it limits the drill-down capability. The calculation is performed only at the Year/Month level, and since it is a calculated column in the view, we cannot dynamically disaggregate the YTD by the other ~198 dimensions in the model (e.g., if we filter by a specific "Customer", the calculated YTD would still be the total across all customers up to that "Month").

4. SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud) - Import Model Test:

  • Approach: We created an Import Model in SAC, and there, the YTD() function (implemented as a calculated account) works perfectly and allows for dynamic drill-down across all dimensions.

  • Limitation: This forces us to lose the Real-Time capability of SAP Datasphere and the Live Connection, which is an unacceptable trade-off for our use case.

Question to the Community

Is there an alternative, supported syntax or method in SAP Datasphere, within the Analytic Consumption Model (or a dynamically aggregate-aware View Builder approach) to calculate YTD while respecting all dimensions in the model?

Any workaround or confirmation on whether the YTD() function in Restricted or Calculated Measures is actually supported in the current version of Datasphere would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

entry.title: Error in data action using attribute within MEMBERSET in MODEL()
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are having troubles with a data action in SAP Analytics Cloud that uses a dimension attribute within the MODEL MEMBERSET. When this process is executed, no sending is made.

This is a screenshot of the step

If I test it using members of the dimension in the MEMBERSET, as for example in this screenshot, the sending is done correctly.

At the same time, if I rewrite the code in this way, it also sends data.

 

 

I wanted to see if anyone else uses dimension attributes for sending data between models, and if so if you also experienced problems running the processes.

I want to remark that this has been developed for quite some time and worked perfectly, it seems to be something fairly recent that stopped working.

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks.

entry.title: ABAP CDS View how to display fields as properties for a Dimension in Live model SAC
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have an ABAP CDS View on an ADSO, for one of the ADSO fields "/bic/z_attivit" I'm trying to display some attributes as properties of the dimension "Attivita" in SAC in a Live Data model based on the CDS View.  I cannot understand what is missing in the code, however I'm not able to see the fields as properties...

Can you please help me and provide any suggestion? this is the CDS View on the Attributes I'm trying to expose: 

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZI_ATTVT_ATTR'

@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true

@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Attività - Attributi (Tabella P, non time-dependent)'

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@ObjectModel.representativeKey: '/bic/zAttivit'

@vdm.viewType: #BASIC

@analytics:{

dataCategory: #DIMENSION,

dataExtraction: {

enabled: true,

delta.changeDataCapture: {

automatic: true

}

}

}

 

@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION, #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET, #SQL_DATA_SOURCE, #CDS_MODELING_DATA_SOURCE, #EXTRACTION_DATA_SOURCE ]

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern: #ANALYTICAL_DIMENSION

 

 

define view ZI_ATTIVITA_ATTR as select from /bic/pz_attivit as p

 

association [0..1] to /bic/tz_attivit as t

on t./bic/z_attivit =p./bic/z_attivit

 

association [0..1] to /bic/tz_mattiv as tm

on tm./bic/z_mattiv=p./bic/z_mattiv

 

{

key /bic/z_attivit as /bic/zAttivit,

key objvers as Objvers,

changed as Changed,

/bic/z_mambito as /bic/zMambito,

/bic/z_ambito as /bic/zAmbito,

/bic/z_mattiv as /bic/zMattiv,

/bic/z_contab as AttivitaFlatSINO,

@Semantics.text: true

t.txtlg as AttivitaDescrizione,

tm.txtlg as MacroAttivitaDescrizione

 

}

 

in the top CDS CUBE i have these reference to the underlying CDS View:

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZI_COMMR011_CUBE'

@EndUserText.label: 'COMM R011 – CUBE (base + SERWDET)'

@ClientHandling.algorithm: #SESSION_VARIABLE

@vdm.viewType: #COMPOSITE

@analytics.dataExtraction.enabled: true

@vdm.lifecycle.contract.type: #PUBLIC_LOCAL_API

@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true

@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true

@analytics: { dataCategory: #CUBE } //, dataExtraction.enabled: true }

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK

@AbapCatalog.buffering.status: #NOT_ALLOWED

@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

@ObjectModel.usageType.sizeCategory: #XXL

@ObjectModel.usageType.serviceQuality: #D

@ObjectModel.usageType.dataClass: #MIXED

@AccessControl.personalData.blocking:#REQUIRED

@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #ANALYTICAL_PROVIDER ]

@ObjectModel.modelingPattern: #ANALYTICAL_CUBE

 

define view ZC_COMMR011_CUBE as select from /bic/ad_commr011 as base

 

 

// Attributi per Attivita' (Campo base: /bic/z_attivit)

association [0..1] to ZI_ATTIVITA_ATTR as _ZAttivitaAttr on _ZAttivitaAttr./bic/zAttivit = base./bic/z_attivit and _ZAttivitaAttr.Objvers = 'A'

{

 

//...fields selection

 

@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_ZAttivitaAttr'

base./bic/z_attivit as /bic/zAttivit,

 

//...more fields

 

_ZAttivitaAttr

}

 

Many thanks for any help.

Filomena

entry.title: Limit the export nodes options for a SAC User with CTMS
entry.content:
I have implemented the CTMS for my SAC. My CTMS is also used for BDC, CPI, GRDC and now SAC.

When i want to export with SAC, I only want the SAC node of my ctms to apear and nothing else. However, in the screenshot you can see, that i also see the other Nodes of my CTMS, but SAC Users should never export to the Datasphere Node of my CTMS for example.

How can i limit the permissions of user to only see the SAC node for export with ctms?
